markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Taw Launcher](/Weapons.aspx?ID=342)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conrasu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=343" />
<trait label="Deadly d10" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Modular (B, P, or S)" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=271" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 31 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 138 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**Damage** 1d10 modular

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

**Range** 100 ft.

**Reload** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Bow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=3)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Wooden Taws](/Weapons.aspx?ID=152)

</column>

---

This complex device is a crossbow and fires small wooden bullets known as taws. A system of blades within the launcher can rapidly reshape a taw as it's loaded, allowing the launcher to fire taws of different shapes, such as fléchettes.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-3" />
name: Taw Launcher

A system of blades within the launcher can rapidly reshape a taw as it's loaded, allowing the launcher to fire taws of different shapes, such as fléchettes.
